attributes.description: Time allowed for the system to initiate evacuation protocols after emergency detection.
attributes.name: responseTime

attributes.description: Operational ambient temperature range to ensure sensor and actuator reliability in variable flight conditions.
attributes.name: operatingTemperatureRange

attributes.description: Redundancy level implemented across sensors and actuators to ensure reliable functioning even if one path fails.
attributes.name: redundancyLevel

attributes.description: Mean Time Between Failures indicating high durability during continuous flight operations.
attributes.name: MTBF

attributes.description: Power specifications ensuring continuous operation during prolonged emergencies with redundant supplies.
attributes.name: powerBackup
attributes.value: Dual redundant power supply with high capacity battery backup

designScenario.description: The Evacuation Control System is designed to orchestrate a coordinated and safe evacuation of an aircraft during emergencies. It integrates advanced door actuation, dynamic cabin guidance, and synchronized emergency lighting with real-time avionics data. The system is optimized to ensure immediate activation, continuous reliability, and fault-tolerant operation under rigorous aviation standards. It also offers a user-friendly interface for cabin crew to monitor system status and perform manual overrides if necessary.
designScenario.name: Evacuation Control System

details.description: Automatically actuate emergency doors and activate directional signage immediately upon detecting critical flight parameters.
Interface with sensors in the avionic suite to validate emergency conditions before initiating protocols.
Guarantee system response to emergency triggers within 2 seconds to minimize delay.
Maintain continuous real-time communication with avionics and lighting modules during evacuation events.
Implement triple redundancy in sensor and actuator circuits to secure operational integrity even with isolated component failures.
Deploy fail-safe logic that ensures system activation only upon verified emergency conditions, minimizing false alarms.
Provide an intuitive interface for cabin crew, incorporating clear alert indicators and manual override options.
Support regular automated diagnostics, remote firmware updates, and compliance with aircraft maintenance schedules.

relationships.description: The Evacuation Control Module depends on the Cabin Guidance Module to relay directional information during evacuation processes.
The Emergency Lighting Assembly is aggregated by the Evacuation Control Module to provide synchronized visual evacuation cues.
The Avionics Integration Module composes the overall system by integrating sensor data from the aircraft's central avionics to trigger system activation.

systemComponents.description: The primary control unit that oversees evacuation operations and interfaces with in-flight avionics systems.
systemComponents.name: Evacuation Control Module

subComponents.description: Automatic door actuator responsible for releasing emergency exits quickly.
subComponents.name: Emergency Door Actuator

subComponents.description: Synchronizes activation of evacuation signals across the aircraft.
subComponents.name: Evacuation Signal Synchronizer

systemComponents.description: Provides in-cabin directional guidance and emergency signage to assist passenger evacuation.
systemComponents.name: Cabin Guidance Module

subComponents.description: Directional exit indicator that highlights the safest evacuation path.
subComponents.name: Directional Exit Indicator

subComponents.description: Digital signage driver that manages dynamic messages and evacuation instructions.
subComponents.name: Digital Signage Driver

systemComponents.description: Delivers structured illumination using LED and strobe technologies to mark evacuation routes.
systemComponents.name: Emergency Lighting Assembly

subComponents.description: LED pathlights fixed along cabin floors to illuminate evacuation paths.
subComponents.name: LED Pathlights

subComponents.description: Strobe beacon lights providing intermittent visual cues for evacuation.
subComponents.name: Strobe Beacon Lights

systemComponents.description: Integrates with the aircraft’s avionics to collect sensor data and send system updates for real-time analysis and maintenance.
systemComponents.name: Avionics Integration Module

subComponents.description: Aggregates data from flight sensors to monitor emergency conditions.
subComponents.name: Sensor Data Aggregator

subComponents.description: Interfaces with the maintenance management system for diagnostic reporting and scheduling.
subComponents.name: Maintenance Interface
